name: Zombeavers Multiple Choice Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: What type of animal did the two guys in the truck hit in the opening scene?
questions.explanation:
Deer.

	The one who was driving was texting and telling his co-worker a story about how he dated a guy once for a week. His friend asked him if he saw the deer in the road and he answered yes, but slammed into it anyway. When they hit the deer a barrel of toxic chemicals fell off the truck and into the river near the road.

questions.text: What was the name of the town where the Zombeavers started attacking people?
questions.explanation:
Ashwood.

	Ashwood had a population of 4,080 according to the sign the three girls drove past on their way into town. The river ran through town and the woods near the city. The beavers had a dam in the river where they trapped the toxic waste and had the canister rupture on them.

questions.text: Whose family owned the cabin the three girls were staying at?
questions.explanation:
Mary.

	The girls arrived at the cabin in a Prius, with Jenn complaining that she had never swum in a lake before. Mary, whose family owned the cabin on the lake said it was much better than swimming in a pool. Zoe chimed in that they'd get more bugs in their mouths.  Mary introduced the other two as her sorority sisters to the elderly neighbor woman who stopped by.

questions.text: What brand of beer were the girls drinking while sunbathing?
questions.explanation:
Ipsum Lorem.

	They were drinking Ipsum Lorem light beer both on the raft in the river and in the cabin. The brand was made up for the movie and didn't really exist. They were all drinking when their boyfriends showed up and surprised them the first night they were there.

questions.text: Why couldn't Jenn call for help?
questions.explanation:
Phone lines were dead.

	As was established when the girls first arrived at the cabin, cellphones had no service. After the second beaver attack she ran from the lake back to the cabin and tried to use the landline, but it was shown that the beavers had clawed the outside of the cabin and cut the phone lines. Apparently the toxic waste that turned them to Zombeavers also gave them superior intelligence.

questions.text: One of the boys tossed Zoe's dog into the lake, sacrificing him to the deadly beavers.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It was the only way he could think to get the three Zombeavers headed in the other direction from the raft. He tossed the dog, Gosling, into the lake and they all watched as the Zombeavers attacked him. The group of five (Jenn was already at the cabin) then dove in the water and swam for safety.

questions.text: Who had their foot bitten off?
questions.explanation:
Buck.

	Buck, played by Peter Gilroy, was in the lake when the beaver bit his foot off.  The group saved his left foot, but it wasn't meant to be reattached as he kept bleeding from the stump. He was among the casualties by the end of the movie.

questions.text: Humans bitten by the Zombeavers eventually turned into zombies too.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Jenn was the first shown to have transformed, though she was only scratched not bitten. She attacked Mary in the bedroom at the cabin. In the next scene Buck turned and killed Smyth before attacking Zoe.

questions.text: What was the human body count for the movie? (IE: How many people died?)
questions.explanation:
10.

	I know, most of you probably didn't count, that's why the numbers are so far off it's easy to estimate. There were 10 humans, 2 dogs, a bear and the deer that was hit by the truck. Plus all the Zombeavers that were killed.

questions.text: What creature is seen eating one of the Zombeavers corpses at the end of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Bee.

	The bee was shown to eat part of the Zombeaver and then fly back to its colony. Setting up a potential sequel Zombees maybe? There was then a line in the credits that no animals were harmed in the making of the movie.
